verses.verse: {To the Music Director: A Davidic Song} {God's Knowledge and Presence} d Lord , you have examined me; you have known me.
You know when I rest {Lit. know my sitting} and when I am active. {Lit. and my rising} You understand what I am thinking when I am distant from you. {Or thinking from a distance}
You scrutinize my life and my rest; {Or death ; Lit. my path and my lying down} you are familiar with all of my ways.
Even before I have formed a word with my tongue, you, Lord , know it completely!
You encircle me from back to front, placing your hand upon me.
Knowledge like this is too amazing for me. It is beyond my reach, and I cannot fathom it.
{The Magnitude of God} d Where can I flee from your spirit? Or where will I run from your presence?
If I rise to heaven, there you are! If I lay down with the dead, {Lit. to Sheol ; i. e. the realm of the dead} there you are!
If I take wings with the dawn and settle down on the western horizon {Lit. the end of the sea}
your hand will guide me there, too, while your right hand keeps a firm grip on me.
If I say, "Darkness will surely conceal me, and the light around me will become night,"{So MT LXX; DSS 11QPs a reads And let me say, "Surely darkness conceals and night has girded me about."}
even darkness isn't dark to you, darkness and light are the same to you. {The Heb. lacks to you}
It was you who formed my internal organs, {Lit. my kidneys} fashioning me within my mother's womb.
I praise you, because you are fearful and wondrous! {So DSS 11QPsa Syr Hieronymus; MT LXX read because I am fearfully and wonderfully made} Your work is wonderful, and I am fully aware of it.
My frame was not hidden from you while I was being crafted in a hidden place, knit together in the depths of the earth.

Your eyes looked upon my embryo, and everything was recorded in your book. The days scheduled {The Heb. lacks scheduled} for my formation were inscribed, even though not one of them had come yet. {The Heb. lacks had come yet}
How deep {Or precious} are your thoughts, God! How great is their number!
Were I to count them, they would number more than the sand. When I awake, I will be with you.
God, if only you would execute the wicked, so that {So LXX DSS 11QPsa; MT reads and so that} the men guilty of bloodshed would get away from me,
who speak against you with evil motives, your enemies who are acting in vain.
I hate those who hate you, Lord , do I not? I loathe those who rebel against you, do I not?
With consummate hatred I hate them; I consider them my enemies.
Examine me, God, and know my mind, test me, and know my thoughts.
See if there is any offensive tendency {Lit. way} in me, and lead me in the eternal way.
